page.title: 12HOUSING IN HALWELL&MORELEIGH
page.content: Halwell and Moreleigh have grown piecemeal,expanding and retracting with the economic clime. The houses are difficult to date because additions and adaptions have blurred outlines, but Stanborough House goes back to the 16thC.,as do many of the farms and 1777 is inscribed on another,whilst many were built during Victorian times. Most houses are stone,some plastered and painted,but none are thatched. Farms in the outlying areas have,inaddition to the farmhouse,cottages to house workers. The style and size of the houses indicates a working peasantry rather than leisured gentry. Each village has 6 Council houses. There are plans to build 14/16 houses and bungalows and property coming on to the open market is quickly sold.
